alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 02 at 1:25PM MST until September 02 at 3:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM MST/345 PM PDT/ THIS AFTERNOON FOR WEST CENTRAL YUMA AND SOUTHEASTERN IMPERIAL COUNTIES... At 125 PM MST /125 PM PDT/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain as been reported. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Yuma, Somerton, Gadsden, Fortuna Foothills, San Luis, Araby, Winterhaven, Andrade and Blaisdell. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
